itemDescription: British screenwriter, producer, and film director

wikipedia_page.main: Widgey R. Newman (1900–1944) was a British screenwriter, producer and film director. He was a major force in the British B film industry of the 1930s, overseeing the production of a number of quota quickies.

link_mentions.page: Cultural depictions of Joan of Arc

|1932 ||Castle Sinister || Widgey R. Newman ||Early British horror film, intriguing tagline "Mad doctor tries to put girl's brain into apeman's head"

Castle Sinister was a 1932 British horror film produced, written and directed by Widgey R. Newman.  Very little is known of either the film or the director, although available information suggests Newman to have been something of a maverick in the British film industry of the time. Castle Sinister is classed as a lost film.
Category:Films directed by Widgey R. Newman

A Sister to Assist 'Er is a 1938 British comedy film directed by George Dewhurst and Widgey R. Newman and starring Muriel George, Polly Emery and Charles Paton. It was based on the play A Sister to Assist 'Er by John le Breton.
Category:Films directed by Widgey R. Newman
| A Sister to Assist 'Er || Comedy || || George Dewhurst, Widgey R. Newman || Muriel George, Polly Emery, Charles Paton

The Dream Doctor is a 1936 British drama film directed by Widgey R. Newman and starring Leo Genn, Sydney Moncton and Yvonne Murray. The film was a quota quickie produced by the independent producer Newman for distribution by the Hollywood studio MGM.Chibnall p.288
Category:Films directed by Widgey R. Newman
| A Reckless Gamble || Widgey R. Newman || Wally Patch, Simeon Stuart || Sports ||
*Little Waitress, directed by Widgey R. Newman, starring Claude Bailey and Moore MarriottWood, Linda. British Films, 1927–1939. British Film Institute, 1986, page 256

Men Without Honour is a 1939 British crime film directed by Widgey R. Newman and starring Ian Fleming, Howard Douglas and Grace Arnold. The film was made at Bushey Studios, as a low-budget B film designed to go on the bottom-half of a double bill.Chibnall p.300
Category:Films directed by Widgey R. Newman

Immortal Gentleman is a 1935 British historical drama film directed by Widgey R. Newman and starring Basil Gill, Rosalinde Fuller and Dennis Hoey.Wood p.82 It was a low-budget B film, which usually did not have historical settings.
Category:Films directed by Widgey R. Newman

On Velvet is a 1938 British musical comedy film directed by Widgey R. Newman and starring Wally Patch, Joe Hayman and Vi Kaley.Wood p.99 It is a musical revue and was distributed by the American company Columbia Pictures.
Category:Films directed by Widgey R. Newman
Lucky Blaze is a 1933 British sports film directed by Widgey R. Newman and starring William Freshman, Vera Sherborne and Moore Marriott. It was made as a quota quickie.Chibnall p.273
Category:Films directed by Widgey R. Newman

Little Waitress  is a 1932 British musical film directed by Widgey R. Newman and starring Claude Bailey and Moore Marriott. It was made at Bushey Studios as a quota quickie.Wood p.268 A romance occurs between an impoverished tourist and a surprisingly wealthy Germany waitress.
Category:Films directed by Widgey R. Newman

Two Smart Men is a 1940 British comedy film directed by Widgey R. Newman and starring Leslie Fuller, Wally Patch and Margaret Yarde.  The film's producer-director Newman had specialized in quota quickies during the previous decade and this production was made as a second feature. It was followed by Henry Steps Out with several of the same cast.Chibnall & MacFarlane p.4
Category:Films directed by Widgey R. Newman

Henry Steps Out is a 1940 British comedy film directed by Widgey R. Newman and starring George Turner, Margaret Yarde and Wally Patch.Chibnall & MacFarlane p.4 On the outbreak of the Second World War an idler is forced to join the army by his domineering wife.
Category:Films directed by Widgey R. Newman

A Reckless Gamble is a 1928 British silent sports film directed by Widgey R. Newman and starring Desmond Roberts, Gladys Dunham and Wally Patch.Murphy p.457 It was released as a quota quickie.Chibnall p.258 It is also known by the alternative title of Man in the Saddle.
Category:Films directed by Widgey R. Newman

Heroes of the Mine is a 1932 British drama film directed by Widgey R. Newman and starring Moore Marriott, Wally Patch and Terence de Marney. It was made as a quota quickie at Bushey Studios.Chibnall p.267
Category:Films directed by Widgey R. Newman
The Unholy Quest is a 1934 British horror film directed by Widgey R. Newman and starring Claude Bailey, Terence de Marney and Christine Adrian. It was made as a quota quickie.Chibnall p.281
Category:Films directed by Widgey R. Newman
